results.title: The Commitments
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, Lynda Myles, Roger Randall-Cutler and Sovereign Pictures
results.brief_description: Alan Parker’s tale of an Irish working class band’s odyssey is a strident belt-you-in-the-mouth delight. On a mission to bring soul to Dublin plus fame and fortune for himself, Jimmy Rabbitte transforms a motley bunch of misfits and raw talent into ‘the hardest working band in the world’, THE COMMITMENTS, billing them as the ‘saviours of Soul’. Based on the cult novel by Roddy Doyle and set to a scorching soul soundtrack. This film pulsates with raw energy, colourful dialogue, working class struggles and big time dreams - it’s a knockout.

results.title: Chaplin
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, Mario Kassar and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Brilliant, enigmatic, beloved, Charlie Chaplin made more people laugh than anyone else in history. His story and the story of filmmaking - inextricably linked together - are brought to the screen in Richard Attenborough’s modern masterpiece. This truly magnificent film starring one of the finest casts from the world of film including: Dan Aykroyd, Geraldine Chaplin, Anthony Hopkins, Marisa Tomei, Kevin Kline and James Woods. This is the story of how this master entertainer survived a deprived and tragic childhood and then transformed such poverty into humour which everyone, everywhere cherished.

results.title: Desert hearts
results.creator_credit: Donna Deitch and Desert Heart Productions
results.brief_description: Set in Nevada 1959, Helen Shaver is Vivian Bell, a repressed college professor from New York who arrives at a ranch in Reno for a temporary stay to obtain a divorce. Anticipating a quiet stay reading and preparing for the academic year she finds herself distracted and drawn to the ranch owner’s fiery step-daughter Cay Rivvers (Patricia Charbonneau). As their friendship develops and Vivian’s restrained and latent passion is unleashed, their lesbian relationship becomes an act of defiance against the accepted rules of society. The memorable soundtrack includes songs by Patsy Cline and other performers of the late 50’s. Based on the novel “Desert of the Heart” by Jane Rule.

results.title: Desert bloom
results.creator_credit: Eugene Corr, Michael Hausman and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in Las Vegas at the time of the first atom bomb tests in 1951, this powerful drama examines the life of a struggling middle-class Nevada family, seen through the eyes of 13 year old Rose Chismore (Annabeth Gish). Finding life difficult with her war-scarred father (Jon Voight), Rose forms a close bond with her flamboyant Aunt Starr (Ellen Barkin) whose friendship comes at a critical time.

results.title: The Hairdresser's husband = Le Mari del la coiffeuse
results.creator_credit: Patrice Leconte, Lambart Productions and TFI
results.brief_description: Death is yellow and smells of vanilla pronounces Antoine, the protagonist of this sunny and optimistic film in which even something sombre is imagined as radiant and sweet. Photographed in glowing primary colours, with some scenes shot in slight slow-motion, this study of male erotic obsession is a lazy, dreamy film about nothing more than a state of being - happiness. Cocooned in their little one-roomed store, Antoine and Mathilde, his luminous wife are sufficient to themselves. Two wonderful performances from Jean Rochefort and Anna Galiena are complemented by the Arab music Antoine loves and original music by Michael Nyman.

results.title: Wendy cracked a walnut
results.creator_credit: Michael Pattinson, John Edwards, Classic Films and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Wendy Walters yearns for the passion she finds between the pages of romance novels. Her life is not bad, just boring. When husband Ronnie forgets their wedding anniversary, Wendy stumbles into an affair with the rich and handsome Jake. All fairy tales must come to an end and even though Wendy discovers that Jake is not Prince Charming, hers still has a happy ending.

results.title: Prizzi's honor
results.creator_credit: John Huston, John Foreman and ABC Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Jack Nicholson stars as Charley Partanna an aging hit-man for a powerful Mafia family, the Prizzis. He meets and falls in love with Irene Walker (Kathleen Turner) the widow of his latest victim, masquerading as a tax consultant. When he discovers that Irene is a hired killer and has cheated his own Mafia family, his loyalties are painfully divided. To complicate matters, Maerose Prizzi, (Anjelica Huston in an Academy Award winning performance for Best Supporting Actress), the black sheep of the powerful clan, harbors a lost love for Charley and manoeuvers the plot of this tragic-comedy in insidious ways. Based on the novel by Richard Condon.

results.title: Gardens of stone
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Michael I. Levy and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: There’s the war-toughened sergeant who passionately longs to train soldiers for fighting in Vietnam, but is assigned to the elite Old Guard. His beautiful girlfriend, a Washington Post reporter who is fervently against the war. The zealous soldier that the sergeant takes under his wing, and the young woman who learns the pain of being an army wife. Their stories are poignantly told in Francis Coppola’s perceptive and moving film that stars James Caan, Angelica Huston, James Earl Jones and Mary Stuart Masterson. This film takes a different look at the Vietnam war era in the United States. It is a drama that captures the anguishing effect of the war on the relationships of the men and women at home. Based on the novel by Nicholas Proffitt. Original music by Carmine Coppola.

results.title: Letter to Brezhnev
results.creator_credit: Chris Bernard, Janet Goddard and Channel Four Films
results.brief_description: A movie about the craziest, most lovable teenagers to come out of Liverpool since the Beatles. It’s a fairytale full of edgy cynical realism. It’s a love story and an adventure with a rock ‘n’ roll soundtrack. It’s a movie about inner-city decay, the frustration of unemployment and people desperate for change - any change. This film has gathered an impressive array of awards and critical praise but its most impressive achievement is evident by its popularity amongst audiences. Starring Peter Firth and features music from Bronski Beat.

results.title: Gregory's girl
results.creator_credit: Bill Forsyth, Clive Parsons, Davina Belling and Lake Film Productions
results.brief_description: At last we get to see a teenager who doesn’t “have it all together”.. one whose attempts to be super cool give way to eagerness, hysterical shyness, clumsiness and woeful incompetence. Gregory (John Gordon Sinclair) suddenly discovers that “playing the field” doesn’t necessarily mean keeping a wide cover on the football ground! His latest obsession is with the new girl on his soccer team, Dorothy (Dee Hepburn), but his schoolmates delightfully manoeuver him into giving the out-going Susan (Clare Grogan) a tumble.
